resources:
Udacity Quiz App Enter Name
Q1: What name was given to the soldiers who protected Roman emperors?Praetorian Guard
Q2: Which two metals is pewter made from? Tin and lead.
Q3: What was Louis Armstrong\'s chosen form of music? Jazz.
Q4: Name the port of Rome. Ostia.
Q5: Paul Newman ate fifty eggs in which film? Cool Hand Luke.
Q6: Books by Arthur Conan Doyle includes Sherlocke Holmes, A Study in Scarlet, The Hound of the Baskervilles, Don Quixote.
Q7: Which cities does the River Lagan flow through? Dunmury, Dublin, Ballyhanich, Belfast.
Q8: Who sang about being an eggman and a walrus? The Beatles.
Roman Guard Venician Guard Praetorian Guard Guard del la emperor
Tin Copper Lead Gold
Rock Metal Classical Jazz
Ostia Venice Rossi Maxigne
Cool Hand Luke Left Leg Duke Major Hand Tom Jasmone
Sherlocke Holmes Don Quixote The Hound of the Baskervilles A Study in Scarlet
Dublin Dunmury Ballyhanich Belfast
AC/DC The Beatles Led Zeppelin Al Quinteno
